bibl.title: Antiochus IV of Syria and Ptolemaic Symbolism: An Example of Anti-Ptolemaic Propaganda.
Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011.

bibl.note: Focuses on the Egyptionized coin series minted in Syria during the military conflict between the Ptolemies and the Seleucids and discusses the reinterpretation of the Ptolemaic propagandistic conceptions by Antiochus IV.
bibl.seg: Artem Anokhin, Antiochus IV of Syria and Ptolemaic Symbolism: An Example of Anti-Ptolemaic Propaganda.

Volker Grieb, Krzysztof Nawotka & Agnieszka Wojciechowska (edd.), Alexander the Great and Egypt. History, Art, Tradition. Wrocław / Breslau, 18. / 19. Nov. 2011 = Philippika. Altertumskundliche Abhandlungen. 74 (Wiesbaden, 2014) pp. 357-365, 1 pl.

Focuses on the Egyptionized coin series minted in Syria during the military conflict between the Ptolemies and the Seleucids and discusses the reinterpretation of the Ptolemaic propagandistic conceptions by Antiochus IV.
